frameDefinitions: An Evaluee, which can be a person or an object, has an amount of acceptability or utilization based on general (often non-aesthetic) desirability.
A Searcher looks all over a Ground in order to find a Sought_entity.
A person (Speaker) expresses a Message or mental content, broadly understood, in a particular Manner.
This frame covers words for Body_part(s) (BP) belonging to a Possessor (Poss), which may be characterized by a Descriptor (Desc).
These words describe the size of message that a Speaker is judged by a (usually unexpressed)
Temporary or permanent Styles and Configurations of Hair, as well as its inherent Nature.
frameExamples: The newcomers <t>combed</t> the area looking for minerals
He had to brace his right <t><fex name='Body_part'>arm</fex></t> against his leg in order to fight the roll.
Graham is very shy with most people, but he gets very <t>chatty</t> with Mr. Roberts.
On either side her head gleamed coiled <t>braids</t> of dark-gold hair , almost pale copper in the subdued light of the room .
listRoleDefinitions: The person or object that is being evaluated for its desirability.
The time when the Evaluee is judged to be desirable.
The geographic area where an <fen>Evaluee</fen> is considered desirable.
The person who is looking all over the <fen>Ground</fen> for the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The location that the <fen>Searcher</fen> covers in looking for the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Searcher</fen> wants to find.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Searcher</fen> scoures the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<fen>Speaker</fen>, the person who encodes the <fen>Message</fen>, occurs as the External Argument of all the verbs:
The <fen>Message</fen> is almost invariably expressed in an NP Object. (The only exceptions occur with the verb <t>express</t>, which is occasionally used with that-clause complements.)

For most of the words in this frame, some expression of <fen>Manner</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> is obligatory. As in other frames, <fen>Manner</fen> expressions characterize the action (in this case, the speech act performed by the <fen>Speaker</fen>). However, a wide range of <fen>Manner</fen> expressions occurs in this frame, including the following types:
<fen>Medium</fen> expresses the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication, such as the language used or the specific type of text in which the <fen>Message</fen> occurs:
This Frame Element denotes the <fen>Possessor</fen> of the <fen>Body_part</fen>.
This Frame Element  is the <fen>Body_part</fen>.
This is the person who is characterized as talkative, reticent etc.  It is usually the External Argument:

<fen>Text</fen> is rarely expressed because the quantity of information given is the focus of the frame, rather than the information content. Texts can occur as NP objects, but cannot be either direct quotes or complement clauses.
This role is the <fen>Topic</fen> on which much or little information is communicated. <fen>Topic</fen> is far more frequent than Message in this frame.
This role is the hair itself
This role is the Possessor of the body part.
Temporary Configurations of hair (eg braid, bun, ponytail).   Something done to the hair merely by movement.
A property of the hair (eg curly, fine, brown).  This acts much like 'Descriptor' in the Observable_bodyparts Frame.  Colors, styles, natural properties are described by this frame element.
listRoleExamples: Electronica is all the rage <fex>in Europe</fex>.
<fex>They</fex> first gained entry into the house of Raja Rao, who resides on the ground floor and ransacked the house for valuables.
I had never really seen much on the bigfoot subject or I would have scoured <fex>the area</fex> for signs and looked for droppings
Coast Guard and Navy ships and aircraft combed the area <fex>for the six aircraft</fex>
The Prime Minister expressed <fex>her sympathy for the victims</fex>.
True Manner: You should phrase it <fex>carefully</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> has been silent on this issue.
Kim is very talkative <fex>about her family and childhood</fex>.
